Umineko Project (UP): ......On Rokkenjima, this day—or rather, this time around—was the same as any other.
Steam (ST): ...On Rokkenjima, this day —or rather, this round— was the same as any other.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......On Rokkenjima, this day--or rather, this round--was the same as any other.
PC Japanese (JP): ……六軒島は、今日も、…いや、今回も何も変わらない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……六軒島は、今日も、…いや、今回も何も変わらない。
Russian (RU): ......На Роккенджиме в этот день — или, скорее, в этот раз — всё было как обычно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em Rokkenjima, no dia de hoje — ou melhor, dessa vez — foi exatamente igual às outras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……六軒島，今天，…不，今次也是毫無改變。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……六轩岛，今天，…不，今次也是毫无改变。

Umineko Project (UP): The typhoon would be coming very soon.{n}The clouds hadn't yet grown thick, but they were moving quickly.
Steam (ST): The typhoon would be coming very soon. The sky was still overcast, but the clouds were moving quickly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The typhoon would be coming very soon. The clouds hadn't yet grown thick, but they were moving quickly.
PC Japanese (JP): 台風はもうじきやってくる。今はまだ曇天だが、雲の流れは速い。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 台風はもうじきやってくる。{n}今はまだ曇天だが、雲の流れは速い。
Russian (RU): Вскоре нагрянет тайфун.{n}Облака ещё не заволокли небо, но быстро набирали скорость.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O tufão logo atingiria a ilha.{n}As nuvens ainda escuras ainda não haviam se formado, mas estavam se movendo rapidamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 台風即將到來。{n}雖現在尚且是陰天，但云流動得很快。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 台风即将到来。{n}虽现在尚且是阴天，但云流动得很快。

Umineko Project (UP): The only thing on Natsuhi's mind was the plan to cover up Kinzo's absence this year as well.
Steam (ST): The only thing on Natsuhi's mind was the plan to cover up Kinzo's absence again this year.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The only thing on Natsuhi's mind was the plan to cover up Kinzo's absence this year as well.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃は、金蔵の不在を今年も何とか誤魔化そうと、その工作に余念がない。
Russian (RU): У Нацухи на уме был лишь план по сокрытию отсутствия Кинзо на этот год.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A única coisa que passava pela mente de Natsuhi era encobrir novamente a ausência de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃為了今年也能好歹把金藏不在的事給瞞混過去，在毫無雜念地專心部署。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃为了今年也能好歹把金藏不在的事给瞒混过去，在毫无杂念地专心部署。

Umineko Project (UP): Krauss appeared to have suffered a stomachache from the stress and was resting in his room.
Steam (ST): Krauss appeared to have suffered a stomachache from the stress and was sleeping in his room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss appeared to have suffered a stomach ache from the stress and was sleeping in his room.
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼はそのストレスのせいか、胃痛を起こし、部屋で休んでいるようだった。
Russian (RU): Краусс из‐за стресса страдал от болей в желудке и спал в своей комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Krauss aparentava estar com dores estomacais devido ao estresse e ficou repousando em seu quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 藏臼大概是因為此事的精神重壓吧，貌似是犯起了胃痛，在房中休息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 藏臼大概是因为此事的精神重压吧，貌似是犯起了胃痛，在房中休息。

Steam (ST): Jessica and Kumasawa had left in a boat to go shopping and greet the incoming relatives on Niijima.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica and Kumasawa had left in a boat to go shopping and greet the incoming relatives on Niijima.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香と熊沢は、買い物と、新島で親族を迎えようと、先ほど船で出て行った。
Russian (RU): Джессика и Кумасава поехали по магазинам и чтобы встретить прибывающих на Нииджиму родственников.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica e Kumasawa partiram em um barco para fazer compras e receber os parentes que logo chegariam em Niijima.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香与熊泽，为了买东西和于新岛迎接亲戚们，于刚才乘船出门了。

Umineko Project (UP): The servants had been busy since the early morning in preparation for the family conference, the greatest event of the year...
Steam (ST): The servants had been busy since the early morning preparing for the family conference, the greatest event of the year...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The servants had been busy since the early morning in preparation for the family conference, the greatest event of the year...
PC Japanese (JP): 使用人たちは皆、一年で最大の行事の準備のため、早朝から慌しい…。
Russian (RU): Слуги были с раннего утра заняты приготовлениями к семейному собранию — главному событию года...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os serviçais passaram a manhã ocupados com os preparativos para a conferência familiar, o maior evento do ano...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 全體傭人們，為做好這個一年中最重要的活動的事前準備，從大清早起就甚是忙亂…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 全体佣人们，为做好这个一年中最重要的活动的事前准备，从大清早起就甚是忙乱…。

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon and Kanon were getting the guesthouse ready.
Steam (ST): Shannon and Kanon were rushing to get the guesthouse ready.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon and Kanon were getting the guesthouse ready.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音と嘉音は、ゲストハウスの準備に追われていた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon e Kanon estavam aprontando a casa de hóspedes.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音与嘉音，正在赶着做宾馆的事前准备。

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "......Shouldn't the guest rooms in the mansion be more than enough to hold the relatives?"
Steam (ST): "...If the relatives are going to stay the night, shouldn't the guest rooms in the mansion be more than enough?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……親族の方々を泊めるなら、お屋敷の客室で充分だろうに。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……親族の方々を泊めるなら、お屋敷の客室で充分だろうに」
Russian (RU): "......Разве гостевых комнат в особняке для родственников не более чем достаточно?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Os quartos de hóspedes da mansão não deveriam ser suficientes para acomodar todos os parentes?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……大屋的客房，明明足以留宿诸位亲戚。」

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "Good point. It is a pain to clean up here as well. ......Even so, I like cleaning the guesthouse."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうね。こっちのお掃除、大変だもんね。……でも、ゲストハウスのお掃除は、好き。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうね。こっちのお掃除、大変だもんね。……でも、ゲストハウスのお掃除は、好き」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É mesmo. É bem trabalhoso ter que ficar arrumando as coisas aqui. ......Embora eu goste de limpar a casa de hóspedes."

Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah, it's nice and quiet without Madam and all the annoying servants."
Steam (ST): "Yeah, it's nice and quiet without Madam and all the annoying servants."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「奥様や、他のムカつく使用人もいないから静かでいいもんね」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, é muito melhor e tranquilo sem a madame e todos os serviçais irritantes."

Steam (ST): Shannon smiled wryly as she performed a detailed examination of the guest room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon smiled bitterly as she performed a detailed examination of the guest room.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音は苦笑いしながら、客室の細部を点検していく。

Umineko Project (UP): Did we forget to clean anything? Do we need to restock anything?{n}She diligently gave the room one final check over......
Steam (ST): Did we forget to clean anything? Do we need to restock anything? She diligently gave the room one final check over...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Did we forget to clean anything? Do we need to restock anything? She diligently gave the room one final check over......

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 掃除のし忘れがないか、消耗品が切れていないか。{n}最後のチェックを、彼女は入念にこなす……。

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "You checked everything thoroughly last night too, didn't you? You really are dedicated."
Steam (ST): "You checked everything thoroughly last night too, didn't you? You really are dedicated."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「昨夜も入念に点検したじゃないか。姉さんは本当にマメだな」

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "It's on days like this when you tend to get pranked if you're careless. ......You can never find important things when you need them, and things that were supposed to be closed turn out to be open."
Steam (ST): "It's days like this that you tend to get pranked if you're careless. ...You can never find important things when you need them, and things that were supposed to be closed turn out to be open."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It's days like this that you tend to get pranked if you're careless. ......You can never find important things when you need them, and things that were supposed to be closed turn out to be open."
PC Japanese (JP): 「こういう日に限って、油断すると悪戯されるの。……いざって時、大切な物が見つからなかったり、閉めておいたはずのものが開いてたり。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「こういう日に限って、油断すると悪戯されるの。……いざって時、大切な物が見つからなかったり、閉めておいたはずのものが開いてたり」
Russian (RU): "В такие дни беспечность может сыграть с тобой злую шутку. ......Можно не найти важные вещи, когда они нужны, а то, что вроде как было закрыто, оказывается открыто."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "São em dias como esses que você acaba sendo vítima de pegadinhas quando se descuida. ......Nunca consegue encontrar coisas importantes quando mais precisa delas, e coisas que deveriam estar fechadas aparecem abertas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「每當這種日子呀，一大意便會受捉弄的哦。……一到關鍵時刻，就找不著重要的東西，明明關好的地方卻開著。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「每当这种日子呀，一大意便会受捉弄的哦。……一到关键时刻，就找不着重要的东西，明明关好的地方却开着。」

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "That's because you're too careless. You don't pay attention while you work."
Steam (ST): "That's because you're too careless. You don't pay attention while you work."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「畢竟姐姐是個冒失鬼呢。只是因為姐姐沒有邊好好確認邊幹活吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「毕竟姐姐是个冒失鬼呢。只是因为姐姐没有边好好确认边干活吧。」

Umineko Project (UP): "I guess that's why you're helping me check. Thanks."

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "But you do. The right to love...is something only you can give yourself. Being furniture or not has nothing to do with it. If you tell yourself "no", then it'll never happen. You mustn't think that way. That's why I gave myself, impudent furniture that I am, the right to fall in love. And you have it too."
Steam (ST): "But that wasn't true. Do you know what's needed to fall in love? It's something you can't get from anyone but yourself. Being furniture or not has nothing to do with it. If you decide for yourself that it won't work out, then it won't. You mustn't leap to such rigid conclusions. That's why I, overambitious furniture that I am, gave myself what's needed to fall in love. So you have it too, Kanon-kun."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "But you did deserve it. You know what? Whether or not you deserve to fall in love is something that you decide for yourself. Being furniture or not has nothing to do with it. Once you decide that it won't work out, then it won't. You mustn't be so rigid. I gave myself, overambitious furniture that I am, the right to fall in love. So you're capable of it too."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): He was a bit shocked to hear that his expression had changed so much that people had apparently noticed as soon as he opened his mouth.

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "You live your life like the sun...and I want to try walking that path alongside you. I have the feeling that, with you, I'd be able to get away from the part of myself that regarded me with contempt and called me furniture."

Russian (RU): "Вы живёте своей жизнью, как солнце, и я хочу попробовать пройти этот путь вместе с вами. Мне кажется, с вами я смогу избавиться от той части себя, которая мебель и которую я так ненавижу."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "You aren't furniture, Kanon‐kun. And you weren't born just so you could become a servant! A boy your age should have the right to enjoy life much, much more...! Ha...hahahaha. I'm the one who's dazzled. You're so dazzling......I can hardly see."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「嘉音くんは家具じゃない。そして使用人になるために生まれてきたのでもない！　年頃の男の子として、もっともっと、人生を楽しんでいいはずなんだよ…！　は、ははははは。私も、……眩しいや。嘉音くんが眩しくて、……目が見られない」
Russian (RU): "Ты не мебель, Канон. И ты родился не просто чтобы стать слугой! Юноши в твоём возрасте должны наслаждаться и наслаждаться жизнью!.. Ха, ха‐ха‐ха. Это меня ослепили. Ты так ослепителен, что...... я с трудом вижу."

Ha...hahahaha. Sou eu quem deveria estar deslumbrada. Você é tão radiante......que eu quase não consigo ver."

Umineko Project (UP): "Th‐there's nothing weak about you...! You've shown me. You've shown me incredible courage by saying you want to change yourself from the way you used to be. So, I'll support you until the end, and I won't rush you until you're ready."

Six years can become a thousand, and a thousand years can be nothing more than a quick nap. ...One can fit an eternity long enough to be deserving of the title "hundred-year-old witch" in a mere two weeks..."

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Umineko Project (UP): "You must choose the path that you are to walk down. ......Let us call it a path of roses. The beautifully blooming roses may celebrate you and they may torment you with their thorns."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あなたの進むべき道は、あなたが決めなさい。……それは恐らく、薔薇の道。美しく咲き誇った薔薇があなたを祝福するかもしれないし、その棘であなたを苛むかもしれない」

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}

PC Japanese (JP): ……しかしそれでも、あなたがいつか辿った道。…その結果、同じ千年を経てもいい。異なる千年を経てもいい。望むなら、道を引き返してもいい。」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Mas, mesmo assim, este é o caminho pelo qual você já caminhou uma vez. ...Você deve passar pelos mesmos mil anos. Talvez acabe passando por diferentes mil anos. Se assim desejar, você pode até retornar para onde veio."

Steam (ST): After being welcomed in by {f:5:Featherine}, ...Beato left on a journey to discover herself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After being welcomed in by Featherine, ......Beato left on a journey to know herself.

Umineko Project (UP): That tale connected the old tale with the new one. It wove them together.
Steam (ST): That tale connected the old tale with the new one. It wove them together.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That tale connected the old tale with the new one. It wove them together.
PC Japanese (JP): その物語が、古い物語を、新しい物語に、繋ぐ。紡ぐ。
Russian (RU): Эта история связала старую историю с новой. Соединила их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Este conto agora se conecta ao velho conto e ao novo conto. Irei tecê‐los juntos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個故事，將老故事與新故事連接、編織在了一起。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个故事，将老故事与新故事连接、编织在了一起。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The thousand‐year‐old tale about her returned to its starting point, becoming a snake eating its own tail.
Steam (ST): ...The thousand-year-old tale about her returned to its starting point, becoming a snake eating its own tail.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The thousand year old tale about her returned to its starting point, becoming a snake eating its own tail.
PC Japanese (JP): ……彼女を巡る千年の物語は、振り出しに戻り、自ら尾を飲み込む蛇となる。
Russian (RU): ......Тысячелетняя история о ней вернулась к исходной точке, становясь змеёй, пожирающей собственный хвост.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O conto de mil anos sobre seu retorno ao seu ponto de partida, transformando‐se em uma serpente comendo sua própria cauda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……圍繞她的千年的故事，回到了開端，成為了一條吞下自己尾巴的蛇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……围绕她的千年的故事，回到了开端，成为了一条吞下自己尾巴的蛇。

Umineko Project (UP): The ring of that snake began slowly, bit by bit, to turn into the shape of a small island floating on the sea.
Steam (ST): The ring of that snake began slowly, bit by bit, to turn into the shape of a small island floating on the sea.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The ring of that snake began slowly, bit by bit, to turn into the shape of a small island floating on the sea.
PC Japanese (JP): その蛇の輪は次第にゆっくりと、大海に浮かぶ小さな島の輪郭となった。
Russian (RU): Кольцо этой змеи медленно, поэтапно приняло форму крошечного острова в море.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O círculo desta serpente começa lentamente, e pouco a pouco vai tomando a forma de uma pequena ilha flutuando no oceano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這條蛇所形成的圈慢慢漸漸地化為了，浮於大海上的小島的輪廓。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这条蛇所形成的圈慢慢渐渐地化为了，浮于大海上的小岛的轮廓。

Umineko Project (UP): That island......was Rokkenjima.
Steam (ST): And that...was Rokkenjima.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That island was......Rokkenjima.
PC Japanese (JP): それが、……六軒島。
Russian (RU): И этот остров...... Роккенджима.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esta ilha......é Rokkenjima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這即是，……六軒島。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这即是，……六轩岛。

Umineko Project (UP): The thousand years of the witch born on this island...were tied to the island.
Steam (ST): The thousand years of the witch born on this island...were tied to the island.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The thousand years of the witch born on this island...were tied to the island.
PC Japanese (JP): この島で生まれた魔女の千年は、この島で紡がれた。
Russian (RU): Тысяча лет ведьмы, рождённой на этом острове, связана с ним.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os mil anos do nascimento da bruxa nesta ilha...estão atados a mesma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這個島上誕生的魔女的千年，是於這個島上編織而成的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这个岛上诞生的魔女的千年，是于这个岛上编织而成的。

Umineko Project (UP): Was it a thousand years, or just six?{n}......Or did this tale start even further back into the past?
Steam (ST): Was it a thousand years, or just six? ...Or did this tale start even further back into the past?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Was it a thousand years, or just six?......Or did this tale start even further back into the past?

Russian (RU): Тысяча или только шесть?{n}......Или же эта история уходит корнями ещё дальше в прошлое?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Teriam sido mil anos, ou foram apenas seis?{n}......Ou quem sabe este conto começou num passado ainda mais distante?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是一個於千年，或 6 年，{n}……又或是于更久以前所開始的故事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是一个于千年，或 6 年，{n}……又或是于更久以前所开始的故事。

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice} went out on a journey to find herself......
Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} went out on a journey to find herself...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beatrice went out on a journey to find herself......
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェは今、自身を探る旅に、出発する……。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Беатриче} отправилась на поиски себя......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} saiu em uma jornada para se encontrar......

Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切于此刻，出发踏上了寻找自己的旅程……。

Steam (ST): The wind had been strengthening since a while back.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The wind had been strengthening since a while back.
PC Japanese (JP): 先ほどから風は強くなっている。
Russian (RU): Ветер усиливался.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O vento estava ficando mais forte já faz algum tempo.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): The breaking waves had grown fierce. The ferryboats probably wouldn't be coming for a while now.

Steam (ST): The crashing thunder told that the island had been sealed off from the outside world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The crashing thunder told that the island had been sealed off from the outside world.

Steam (ST): A thick rain poured down, mocking the fools outdoors who had to rush pathetically to find shelter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A thick rain poured down, mocking the fools outdoors who had to rush pathetically to find shelter.
PC Japanese (JP): 大粒の雨がぼたぼたと降り注ぎ、戸外の愚か者たちに、無様に駆けて屋根の下へ逃げ帰れと嘲笑った。
Russian (RU): Лил сильный дождь, издеваясь над дураками вне дома, жалко спешащими найти укрытие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A chuva espessa caia como uma tormenta, debochando dos tolos ao ar livre que corriam pateticamente para se abrigarem.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 大粒的雨“啪嗒啪嗒”地从天空倒下，讲着“快连滚带爬地逃回屋里吧”地嘲笑户外的蠢货。

Umineko Project (UP): No longer would anyone be able to leave this island.{n}......And no longer would anyone be able to reach this island.
Steam (ST): No longer would anyone be able to leave this island. ...And no longer would anyone be able to reach this island.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No longer would anyone be able to leave this island.......And no longer would anyone be able to reach this island.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ninguém mais seria capaz de deixar a ilha.{n}......E mais ninguém seria capaz de chegar à ilha.

Steam (ST): ...No one, unless blessed with a miracle.

Umineko Project (UP): There was another flash of lightning.{n}......The retinas of all who saw it were filled with white.
Steam (ST): There was another flash of lightning. ...The retinas of all who saw it were filled with white.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There was another flash of lightning.......The retinas of all who saw it were filled with white.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Novamente, um novo raio caiu.{n}......As retinas de todos que o testemunharam foram preenchidas de branco.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 又一道，巨大的落雷。{n}……它将看到它的所有人的视网膜，摧残成了一片雪白。

Umineko Project (UP): As that white faded away, ......an eerie silhouette pulled itself up at the raging water's edge...
Steam (ST): As that white faded away, ...an eerie shadow pulled itself up amidst the raging waters of the beach...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As that white faded away, ......an eerie shadow pulled itself up amidst the raging waters of the beach...
PC Japanese (JP): それがゆっくりと晴れた時、激しい波打ち際に、……ずるりと不気味な人影が起き上がる…。
Russian (RU): Вспышка исчезла...... и среди неистовых вод пляжа поднялась жуткая тень...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E conforme o branco ia desaparecendo, ......uma ominosa silhueta levantou‐se em meio às enfurecidas águas da praia...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這層雪白慢慢褪去之時，在被海浪激烈拍打的海灘上，……“嗞溜”地坐起了個陰森的人影…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这层雪白慢慢褪去之时，在被海浪激烈拍打的海滩上，……“嗞溜”地坐起了个阴森的人影…。

Umineko Project (UP): As though suddenly remembering, it coughed violently several times, filthily spitting out the sea water that had filled its stomach.
Steam (ST): As though suddenly remembering to do so, it coughed violently several times, filthily spitting out the sea water that had filled its stomach.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As though suddenly remembering, it coughed violently several times, filthily spitting out the sea water that had filled its stomach.
PC Japanese (JP): それは思い出したかのように激しく何度も咳き込み、胃袋に詰まった海水を汚らしく吐き散らした。
Russian (RU): Как будто вдруг вспомнив, она сильно кашлянула несколько раз, грязно сплёвывая морскую воду, заполнившую желудок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como se estivesse recordando repentinamente, ela tossiu violentamente diversas vezes, cuspindo a água do mar que havia preenchido seu estômago.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像想起來了似的，此人不停地劇烈咳嗽，將胃裡的海水髒兮兮地胡亂吐了出來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像想起来了似的，此人不停地剧烈咳嗽，将胃里的海水脏兮兮地胡乱吐了出来。

Steam (ST): ...She then tore apart the touch fastener of her life jacket... and threw down the reason she had been able to float here without so much as a thank you.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She then tore apart the velcro of her life jacket and threw down the reason she had been able to float here without so much as a thank you.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そしてライフジャケットのマジックテープを乱暴に引き千切り、何の感謝もせず、彼女を波間に漂わせてくれたそれを叩き付けるように投げ捨てる。
Russian (RU): ......Разорвав липучку на спасательном жилете, она неблагодарно бросила вниз то, благодаря чему смогла доплыть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E então, arrancando o velcro de seu colete salva‐vidas, ela se livrou da razão que a fez flutuar até ali, sem a intenção de demonstrar qualquer agradecimento.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……接着，她粗暴地扯断救生衣的魔术贴，毫无任何感谢，如狠砸下去般地扔掉了令她漂浮于波浪间的救生衣。

Umineko Project (UP): "Hahahahahahaha, ahahahahahahahaha!! Gurgh, *cough*cough*cough*, haah, haah, haah... ......*cackle*cackle*, ahahahahahahaha!! Welcomed in by a storm, same as always! Very <good>! And now, you and I are going to have some fun...Battler‐san!!"
Steam (ST): "Hahahahahahaha, ahahahahahahahaha!! Gurgh, *cough*cough*cough*, haah, haah, haah... ...*cackle*cackle*, ahahahahahahaha!! Welcomed in by a storm, same as always! Very <good>! Yes, come and entertain me, Battler-san!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hahahahahahaha, ahahahahahahahaha!! Gurgh, *cough*cough*cough*, haah, haah, haah... ......*cackle*cackle*, ahahahahahahaha!! Welcomed in by a storm, same as always! Very <good>! Yes, come and entertain me, Battler-san!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「はっはははははは、あっはっはっはっはっはっは！！　うがッ、げほげほごほごほガハァッ、っは、っはあ、はぁ、…。……くっくくくく、あっははははははははははは！！　いつも変わらぬ、嵐での歓待、実にグッドです！　さぁ、楽しませてもらいますよ、戦人さんッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха, аха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха!!! Ургх, *кха*кха*кха*, ха‐а, ха‐а, ха‐а... ......*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*, аха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха! Как всегда, штормовое приветствие! <Good>! Да, повеселите меня, Баттлер!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hahahahahahaha, ahahahahahahahaha!! Gurgh, *cof*cof*cof*, haah, haah, haah... ......*gargalhada*gargalhada*, ahahahahahahaha!! Como sempre, sendo recebida pela tempestade! É verdadeiramente {i:good}! Vamos, está na hora de começarmos a nossa diversão...Battler‐san!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哈、哈哈哈哈哈哈，啊、哈、哈、哈、哈、哈、哈！！嗚嘎，咕呵咕呵咳哄咳哄噶哈啊，哈、哈啊、哈啊，…。……哼、哼哼哼哼，啊、哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈！！一如既往毫無改變的，暴風雨的歡迎，實在是 GOOD！來吧，讓我樂樂吧，戰人！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哈、哈哈哈哈哈哈，啊、哈、哈、哈、哈、哈、哈！！呜嘎，咕呵咕呵咳哄咳哄噶哈啊，哈、哈啊、哈啊，…。……哼、哼哼哼哼，啊、哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈！！一如既往毫无改变的，暴风雨的欢迎，实在是 GOOD！来吧，让我乐乐吧，战人！！」
